intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium cinerelliceps, commonly known as the ash-colored hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, grayish hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is native to parts of Europe and has been introduced to other regions, where it can sometimes become invasive.
